text: (En fût chez OBriens): Une enveloppe grasse et sauvage contient des céréales vigoureux et variés, des petits fruits rouges et un bon équilibre acétique.

From tap at Pizza Port, Carlsbad. pours clear and golden orange with a lacing white head. Smooth spiced and light caramel malty aroma. Spiced base flavour with a solid caramel malt presence and mild bitterness towards the finish. Caramel lingering into the far finish yet with a constant dry spice note.

Draft. A hazy amber beer with a thin lazing beige head. The aroma is sweet with a strong spicy note of coriander and more, with an underlying note of caramel. The flavor is sweet wtih notes of caramel on which is a strong note of spices with coriander being strongest.

Sample at San Diego Brewing Company. Pours a clear dark amber color with a thin beige head that recedes steadily. Spotty lacing. Aroma of yeast, malt and light peppery hops. Medium-bodied and clean with flavors of yeast, fruit and spices. Sweet caramel malt undertones as well. The finish is spiced with a fruity aftertaste. Pretty good overall.
On draft at San Diego Brewery.  Nice and smooth, caramely thick with brown sugar.  Well balanced.

On tap at SD Brewing Company; poured a really nice reddish color.  Aroma was hoppier than expected with a goo amount of caramel malt balance.  Flavor wasnt quite as hoppy, which was a bit surprising based on the aroma.  Flavor was good and well balanced.  Caramel and toasted malt with some vanillal and spices.  A really good version for the style.
Murky amber.  Big, bright caramel nose with white pepper.  Caramel malts to the fore with earthy accents and hints of vanilla.  Somewhat minerally finish.

UPDATED: APR 24, 2008 Draught @ Hamiltons, SD. Served in tulip. Deep ancient, antiqued hues. Not much lacing. Good balance with sweet caramel and nutmeg. Solid. Some unripeness. Off-dry. Slight smoke. Genuinely good.

(on tap @ fathers office.)red body with not much head.its was hard to grab any aroma but i did pick up malts and a bit of funk.the flavor was really nice though.cinnamon,allspice,a hint of sourness,caramel malts,and perfume.awesome flavor for sure.

Light amber in color. Aroma is sweet and spicy. Flavor is more sweet yeast and spice, mild fruit with a bitter/sour aspect as well. I have had better saisons, and I like some of their other beers alot more, but all in all, not bad.

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2008 Name: Bier de Mars
Date: 12/04/2005
Mode: Draft
Source: Lucky Baldwins, Pasadina

Appearance: clear amber, thin beige head with some nice lace, 
Aroma: musty dust bunny aroma, 
Body: thin body, 
Flavor: malty flavor, touch of wood, hint of sourness, a little barnyard funk, lots of wild complexity, could take days to isolate it all

Aroma: 6/10; Appearance: 5/10; Flavor: 7/10; Palate: 5/10; Overall: 11/20
Rating: 3/5.0Drinkability: 6/10
Score: *4

served on tap. poured amber in color with a thin tan head that dissipated rather quickly. the aroma was quite sweet, and the taste seemed to match. quite creamy and delicious. not the easiest beer to finish, but definitely a good take on a saison.

On tap at the Beachwood BBQ.  Pours a mostly hazy, deep ruddy amber color with a thin layer of off-white head.  Aromas of cherry gumdrops, bubblegum, and a mild white pepper spice.  Medium-full bodied, creamy carbonated mouthfeel.  Lots of honey and floral rose petals on the front of the palate, but finishes heavy and sticky sweet with a final smack of bandagey bubblegum.  Too heavy and cloying to be highly drinkable.

On tap @ Stone - Pours a hazy orangish- amber color with a small off white head that faded pretty quick.  No lacing.  Aroma is spice, light yeast, and esters.  Flavor is the same.  Medium body.  This is one of the more spicey beers Ive tried.  A good one.

UPDATED: JUN 17, 2007 On tap at Stone.  Hazzy reddish brown with fizzy white head.  Aroma of caramel and fruit.  Tick silky palate.  Tastes of caramel, malt, fruit, alcohol, and a hint of vanilla with a semi-dry finish.

Sampled on tap at Lucky Baldwins, June 2007
This beer sits in my glass with a somewhat hazy, dark amber, purple hued color.  It is topped by a frothing, fat finger thick, dark tan head that has some staying power to it and even leaves some lacing on the sides of the glass.  The aroma has a pronounced mix of spice and fruit notes; the spices lean towards clove and the fruit notes definitely are concentrated (I get notes of prunes, figs and perhaps some raisins).  The malt aromas mix in with the dark fruit notes, but I do get notes of caramelized malt and browned biscuits.

A light carbonation makes for a smooth drinking beer.  There is a prominent clove character here, but also a hint of nutmeg and allspice.  Dark fruit flavors of fig and raisin come into play.  Some cardamom like spice character is vaguely evocative of the flavors in cola.  The body has a medium fullness to it and this has quite a bit of heft to it considering I was expecting a lighter beer.  This is a nice beer for the cooler months, while not thick, it does have a certain hardness to it.

Barrel Aged draft @ Lucky Baldwins 12/05:  Clear amber color with a minmal off-white head.  Some funky notes in the aroma right off the bat.  Clovey spice, leather, estery.  Sweet fruity flavor with caramel notes and a light spice and touch of wood.  Silky soft mouthfeel.

Draft at Obriens.  Pretty good stuff.  Medium Amber red color with not a lot of head.  Aromas were sweet with a bit of cherry in there.  The rest was very malty.  Malty flavors and a bit of wood from the oak aging.  I like it.

(Draft: 2005 Stone 9th Anniversary Festival in Escondido, CA) My first beer of this festival is a good one.  This version of Craftsmans Biere de Mars is barrel fermented with Brettanomyces, so its probably a bit different from the standard version.  The nose is somewhat sour, spicy, fruity, some banana and general funk.  Similar notes in the flavor, with banana and spices, but also some tart cherry from start to finish.  Moderate bitterness in the finish is the only thing Im not liking in this beer.  Amber color, fully clear, with a steady stream of carbonation bubbles rising through the beer.  The off-white head is small on the pour, but slowly subsides to a broken film, leaving some patchy lacing.  Light-medium in body, very clean and refreshing.  Nice start to the festival.

UPDATED: JUN 24, 2007 re-rate 6/24/07, on tap at the stone bistro, enjoyed it tremendously, an explosion of flavors.

original rating
Had this at the Stone 9th anniversary party. This was barrel aged w/ brett.
This is a Very Tasty beer. Lots of complex flavors. Its a hazy brown color. Ithoroghly enjoyed it.

Sampled with SoCal RB guys...thanks to whomever who brought this...Smoked bacon notes with hints of licorice.  Corn husks are also detected.  Barnyard notes.  In a way, this resembles a rauchbier.  The aroma is all over the place.  Moderate/severe hazy copper/amber color with a small white head.  Nice flavors- sweet, fruity banana-cloves.  Sugary to start.  Finishes bitter and a little astringent for me.  Nice flavor.

This brew pours with an amber-orange body topped by a thin to medium thick head with some lacing.  The aroma is slightly sweet with lots of banana notes, some clove and some yeast.  The flavor is slightly sweet yet a touch sour with notes of clove, a little banana and a touch of yeast.  Medium bodied and dry.
Poursa golden yellow hue with a small, frothy white head.  Aromas of pine, citrus and yeast.  Flavors of butter, pine, citrus, and flowers.
